meanings.sent1: The soldier looked shellshocked after the explosion.
meanings.sent2: She was shellshocked by the unexpected news.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked shellshocked when it saw a cat for the first time.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel shocked or traumatized.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise shellshocked the audience.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie scene shellshocked the viewers.
meanings.sent3: The prank was meant to shellshock him, but he just laughed.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the book shellshocked the readers.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in weather shellshocked the picnic attendees.
